title.narrative: 1. SOCIAL PROTECTION MECHANISMS

description.narrative: BY 2022, Central and decentralized departments, CSOs and local governments have strengthened capacity to set up appropriate social protection mechanisms., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: by 2022, Children (girls/boys) and women, especially the most disadvantaged, have better access to social protection programmes and the state budget allocation to exercise their rights.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: BY 2022, Central and decentralized departments, CSOs and local governments have strengthened capacity to set up appropriate socialprotection mechanisms.

description.narrative: Many of the achievements supported by UNICEF relate to the generation of evidence to inform the development of the next National Social Protection Strategy scheduled to start in 2023. UNICEF’s sustained advocacy led to the adoption of a decree for the establishment of a single social register. The SIDA funded Child Sensitive Social Protection programme is now at its cruising speed. In addition, the search for synergy between social protection and humanitarian cash transfers is making good progress. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/01/2022
